page.title: 19THE RITZ, LINCOLN.
page.content: On the High Street is the old Odeon Cinema renamed the{ Ritz Theatre.}It opened under its new name in February 1985 and shows live entertainment as well as films. However, it is threatened with{closure}before the end of the year. Box office takings are disappointing and the theatre is losing money at the rate of{Â£500}a week. The former Odeon closed when cinema audiences dwindled. Now it seems that the Ritz is faring little better, despite the appearance of Hollywood stars such as{Omar Shariff. Only{14}people watched a film on one night in May and the owner was disappointed. He is quoted as saying that the cinema side of the business is disastrous and if Lincoln people were not careful, the place would be a{parking lot}or a{supermarket}by this time next year.
